title: Morally enforced behaviour through guilt
content: Shaming and blaming is a prominent guilt-raising mechanism when it comes to ascribing responsibility. Approaches based on the negative emotion of guilt primarily aim to shift negatively pressuring emotions away from oneself. Arising from either within or coming from others, guilt is derived through a perceived conflict between actions and values. (Wikipedia contributors, 2020f). It thereby becomes a driver for remorseful action aiming for compensation.
